column4: I want to install Xubuntu on an old computer, preserving Windows 98 partition. How can I divide the only partition present to use the free space without loosing Win 98 data? Can anybody help me, please?
xbutunu will doit
and I can be sure that no data will be loss?
the partition is FAT32
if I loose data, my girlfriend will probabily kill me
u cANNOT be sure
but usually there are no problems, right?
many times I did it, I lost my Windows and it became corrupt!  there are no guarantees
usually there are probs
backup first
its very risky
do it at your own risk
oh thanks a lot!
welcome to reality.  no fantasy stories here
I guess I will buy an old hard disk to put there .... and I will install Linux on the second hard drive
install it on a secoind HDD
yep
and some times its not installed completely and corrupted my windows boot sectors
I appreciate that... that's excatly what I wanted to hear :)
thanks for your help
dont install it on same HDD unless u dont care if you lose windows
np
when I try to run LiveCD it stops at the message: "Probing/Loading AGP Modules.  Any way around this?  And what is AGP?

oh I see! So I will buy another HD ... I installed on the same HD on my Laptop, but there was a partition already done, so it was very easy. On this other case, I will buy a small HD :P thanks and bye!
